description:
Employee Benefits Corporation is hiring for Regional Sales Directors to help grow our business in the Upper Midwest and Mid-Atlantic regions. The Regional Sales Director works closely with brokers, agencies, carriers, employers, professional organizations, community organizations and contractors to promote and sell Employee Benefits Corporation’s suite of products. This position establishes and fosters ongoing and trusted working relationships with the broker distribution channel and clients. The Regional Sales Director ensures profitable growth in sales and revenue within the assigned region by achieving established goals and assists in the operational administration of successful onboarding.

Responsibilities Include:
• Prospect and develop clients in the assigned market area
• Consult with prospective brokers, employers, carriers and referral sources to design benefit plan solutions that include the products and services offered by Employee Benefits Corporation
• Establish and foster working relationships with external clients and brokers, developing and sustaining a growing prospect pipeline
• Represent company at industry events and tradeshows
• Develop written responses to requests for proposals
• Prepare service agreements
• Promote and cross sell additional products and services to clients and brokers
• Maintain and proactively manager client communications, sales activities and data within CRM database

Qualifications:
• Minimum 5 years’ experience selling through the broker channel
• Must have established broker/client relationships in the Mid-Atlantic or Upper Midwest region of the United States
• Sales experience in health experience industry
• Prior experience in developing and implementing a business development plan
• Exceptional relationship building skills with customer focus mindset
• Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills
• Strong organizational and time management skills
• Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
• Experience utilizing CRM systems
• Familiarity with training, conferencing, and virtual meeting technologies
• Ability and willingness to travel frequently to client sites, meetings or conferences throughout the year that may require overnight stays
• Possession of a valid driver’s license and access to reliable transportation

We offer:
• A friendly, collaborative team environment
• A competitive compensation and benefits package
• Opportunities for personal and professional growth
• Flexible scheduling to encourage and support a healthy work-life balance

More About Us:

Employee Benefits Corporation administers a variety of employee benefits, from IRS-approved, tax-advantaged plans to COBRA and state-regulated continuation administration through informative education materials, dedicated reporting, creative plan design and expert customer support. We work with benefit brokers and consultants, employers and HR administrators, and benefit plan participants to offer top-notch workplace benefits and customer service.

Employee Benefits Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Our affirmative action program is available to any applicant or employee upon request.

If you need an accommodation as part of the employment process, please contact Human Resources via email at HumanResources@ebcflex.com or via phone at (608) 831-8445.
We are an equal-opportunity employer.
